title: TVLine Items: Bridgerton Season 4 Virtual Panel, Trevor Noah Back as Grammys Host and More
description: What better way to mark Valentine’s Day than with Bridgerton’s newest couple? Netflix and Shondaland will host a virtual “Season of Love” fan celebration on Friday, Feb. 14, that will include Season 4 news and a live Q&A (at 10 am ET) with stars Luke Thompson and Yerin Ha, who play lovebirds Benedict and Sophie […]
author: Vlada Gelman
excerpt: Netflix sets virtual 'Bridgerton' Q&A on Feb. 14 with Season 4 stars Luke Thompson and Yerin Ha, showrunner Jess Brownell and host Golda Rosheuvel.
text: What better way to mark Valentine’s Day than with Bridgerton‘s newest couple? Netflix and Shondaland will host a virtual “Season of Love” fan celebration on Friday, Feb. 14, that will include Season 4 news and a live Q&A (at 10 am ET) with stars Luke Thompson and Yerin Ha, who play lovebirds Benedict and Sophie in the upcoming run. The conversation will also feature showrunner Jess Brownell and will be hosted by actress Golda Rosheuvel (aka Queen Charlotte). The event will stream on Tudum.com and Shondaland.com (click here to RSVP). Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well… * Trevor Noah will return as host of the 67th Annual Grammy Awards, airing live Sunday Feb. 2 at 8 pm ET/5 pm PT on CBS. * Rhona Mitra (The Last Ship) has joined Joel Kinnaman in the TNT miniseries Debriefing the President (working title), based on real-life CIA analyst John Nixon, who was the first American official to positively identify and interrogate Iraqi president Saddam Hussein following his capture, our sister site Deadline reports. * James Nesbitt (Cold Feet), Ruth Jones (Gavin & Stacey), Minnie Driver (The Serpent Queen) and Alfred Enoch (How to Get Away With Murder) have boarded Harlan Coben’s Netflix series Run Away, per The Hollywood Reporter. * Prime Video has released a trailer for Tribunal Justice Season 2, premiering Monday, Jan. 27: Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
html:
What better way to mark Valentine’s Day than with Bridgerton‘s newest couple?

Netflix and Shondaland will host a virtual “Season of Love” fan celebration on Friday, Feb. 14, that will include Season 4 news and a live Q&A (at 10 am ET) with stars Luke Thompson and Yerin Ha, who play lovebirds Benedict and Sophie in the upcoming run. The conversation will also feature showrunner Jess Brownell and will be hosted by actress Golda Rosheuvel (aka Queen Charlotte).

The event will stream on Tudum.com and Shondaland.com (click here to RSVP).

Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well…

* Trevor Noah will return as host of the 67th Annual Grammy Awards, airing live Sunday Feb. 2 at 8 pm ET/5 pm PT on CBS.

* Rhona Mitra (The Last Ship) has joined Joel Kinnaman in the TNT miniseries Debriefing the President (working title), based on real-life CIA analyst John Nixon, who was the first American official to positively identify and interrogate Iraqi president Saddam Hussein following his capture, our sister site Deadline reports.

* James Nesbitt (Cold Feet), Ruth Jones (Gavin & Stacey), Minnie Driver (The Serpent Queen) and Alfred Enoch (How to Get Away With Murder) have boarded Harlan Coben’s Netflix series Run Away, per The Hollywood Reporter.

* Prime Video has released a trailer for Tribunal Justice Season 2, premiering Monday, Jan. 27:

Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
